name: Alamo Beer Company
description:
Alamo Beer Company is the brainchild of Eugene Simor of San Antonio, Texas. Handcrafted just a day’s ride from the Alamo. So the next time you’re in town, remember to raise some ale.

We deliver pure & honest Texas beer. A smooth and refreshing golden ale brewed with a fiercely independent spirit.

name: Alpine Beer Company
description:
Alpine Beer Company opened its doors in the fall of 2002. Years before, an interest in craft brewing developed into an actual goal for the future. There were years of home brew competitions, brew science classes, and extended beer runs thinly disguised as vacations. 
The brewery went through an expansion starting in late 2008 and became operational in mid 2009. Four double sized fermentors were installed in an old garage behind the current brewery. A cold box was erected adjacent to the garage and a bottling machine with a nice labeler are housed there too. There is a small barrel shed on the shady, north side of the garage.

name: Amicas Pizza, Microbrews and More
description: Amicas’ award winning brewery produces a wide spectrum of ales and lagers to accompany your meal. We’ve got delicious beer selections on tap, as well as our foamy house made root beer (made with honey and real vanilla).

name: Blacksburg Brewing Company
description: Blacksburg Brewing Co. (BBC) is an independent specialty brewer of premium beer.  As mandated by the Reinheitsgebot (German Purity Law), our beer is brewed with only 4 ingredients: water, barley malt, hops, and yeast.  The best beer requires the best ingredients, so we purchase them regardless of the cost.  We pay a premium to import the Cadillac of barley malt from Bamberg, and our hops from The Hallertau are the best that money can buy, period.

name: Blue and Gray Brewing Co
description: The Blue & Gray Brewing Co. opened in Fredericksburg on March 17, 2002.  Before that, Fred Red Ale and the Blue & Gray Classic Lager were brewed at other  microbreweries in Virginia. We listened to customer input and perfected our recipes  before we started brewing in Fredericksburg. Blue & Gray Brewing Co. now offers Falmouth American  Pale Ale and Stonewall Stout for a total of four flavors year round. We also offer Spiced  Winter Ale for Thanksgiving through January, Chocolate Raspberry Stout for January-February and  Virginia Hefeweizen Memorial Day through Labor Day.

name: Bobcat Cafe & Brewery
description:
Located at the heart of the Green Mountains, we have the unique pleasure of serving handcrafted beers along side homemade food that is fresh and creative. Our brewmaster, Mark Magiera, uses high quality grains, hops and yeast strains to create up to a dozen true to style beers. With his unending expertise, Mark is passionate and innovative without losing the tradition behind each style. In the kitchen, we work hard to bring consistency and quality to the table. We focus on local ingredients to enhance our creative comfort food.

The Bobcat Cafe and Brewery opened ten years ago as a community supported business. Today, we strive to support and enhance the community by hosting benefit dinners and by providing a comfortable spot where local people can meet and socialize. Our 100 member Mug Club is a testament to the dedication of our regulars.

Sunday - Thursday

Friday - Saturday
5:00 PM - 9:30 PM

name: Georgetown Brewing Company
description: Georgetown Brewing Company, a Seattle microbrewery and brewer of Manny's Pale Ale. We're a draft beer only production brewery, which means that all we do is make beer and fill kegs. Sorry, no brewpub, but we do have a retail shop where you can pick up kegs to go, growlers, and perhaps get a taste of our newest beer before it's released. Or you could be social and get out to your favorite local watering hole. If they don't have our beer on tap, let us know and we'll do our best to pester 'em into submission. Do we bottle? Not yet but we never say never. Right now we're focused on doing one thing right... draft beer. Cheers!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday to Friday 10am to 6pm
Saturday 10am to 4pm

name: Mill Street Brewery
description: At Mill Street Brewery, we brew with the finest ingredients in small batches, yielding lagers and ales of exceptional quality and taste…and that’s no easy feat! Our dedication to our craft and passion for pushing the envelope has earned us some serious accolades since we officially opened in December 2002.

name: Milly's Tavern
description: Milly's Tavern first opened its doors in January of 2002 at the location of the former Stark Mill Brewery. Milly's opened through the hard work and love of the craft of Master Brewer Peter Telge, a New Hampshire native, who has been brewing his own beers for the better part of 20 years. With the closing of the Stark Mill Brewery and the many changes that have befell the city in the recent years, Peter felt that Manchester, as New Hampshire's Queen City, was sadly falling the way of commercial and contract beers. He, with a dedicated following of fans of his brew, set to work reopening the brewery as "Milly's Tavern," proudly operating as Manchester's only brew pub. We welcome you as our guests to stop by and try a glass of Peter's hard work.

locations.name: Main Brewpub

Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am

name: Moosejaw Pizza & Dells Brewing Company
description:
Moosejaw Pizza & Dells Brewing Co. proves that All Restaurants Are Not Created Equal!

We feature steaks, ribs, burgers, pastas, salads & sandwiches. The Dells only micro-brewery features ten hand-crafted brews. From our tanks straight to your glass…that’s fresh. Large arcade, pool table & premium sports viewing located on the 3rd floor. Large Groups Welcome! Family Friendly! Free Delivery! (608)254-1122

name: New Albanian Brewing
description: The Brewery was officially brewing in October 2002 and was incorporated in 1994 as the New Albanian Brewing Company in a room that branches off of Sportstime Pizza. The brewery established by Roger Baylor his wife Amy (O'Connell) Baylor and her sister Kate O'Connel. This is the first commercial brewery in New Albany since 1935. The first brewmaster was Michael Borchers which brought with him experience and used machines from the now defunct Silver Creek Brewing Corporation that was located in Sellersburg, Indiana. Jared Williamson and Jesse Williams are the current brewers working the brewery. In 2005, 14,000 gallons of beer was produced by the brewery, and with the new additions, the planned output for 2007 is double the 2005 amount.

name: Nøgne Ø
description: Nøgne ø is Norway's leading and largest supplier of bottle conditioned ale and the first and only producer of unfiltered sake in Europe. We make more than 20 different styles of ale & 5 different sake!

name: Old North State Winery & Brewery
description: Old North State is the only winery in the state of North Carolina that is a licensed brewery. Our American Style Pale Ale uses Hops grown in Oregon with only natural products and whole grains in our production. Our hand crafted Ales are made in small batches and are available on tap at our tasting bar.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Tours Monday thru Saturday typically at 11:00 am, 1:00 pm and 3:00 pm or by special appointments

name: Pig's Eye Brewing Company
description:
Pig's Eye Brewing Company was established in 2002.  The previous owner of the Pig's Eye brands, Minnesota Brewing Company, had gone out of business in June of that year.  We (two former Minnesota Brewing Company employees - Phil Gagne', the Brewmaster, and Jeff Crawford, the VP of Sales) formed Pig's Eye Brewing Company, and purchased the Pig's Eye brands from ... Minnesota Brewing company's creditors in September 2002. 

With the old brewery closed, and  limited resources at our disposal, we applied for, and received, permission from the Bureau of Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau to brew as an "alternating proprietor" at City Brewing Company - La Crosse, WI; a brewery with a longstanding brewing heritage, and a commitment to quality.  As an "alternating proprietor", we are a "brewery within a brewery", essentially renting brewing and packaging equipment from City whenever we are brewing and packaging our products.

Our inaugural brews of Pig's Eye Pilsner and Pig's Eye Light were started on February 18, 2003, with the 1st product run was on March 25, 2003.  To the chagrin of some of our loyal customers, we made the decision to drop the "Pirate" rendering of "Pig's Eye" from our packaging, in favor of a historically accurate portrayal of Pierre "Pig's Eye" Parrant.  In May 2004, in response to consumer interest in low-carb products, we replaced Pig's Eye Light with Pig's Eye Lean Light (the original Pig's Eye light beer).  Our product line expanded again in January 2006 - with the introduction of Pit Bull High Gravity Ice Malt Liquor, and again in June 2007 - with the re-introduction of Pig's Eye Ice.  We  also, for a short period of time, operated as an alternating proprietorship and packaged 24/12 Returnable Bottles at Stevens Point Brewery- Stevens Point, WI, but had to discontinue the production of the returnable bottle package due to increases in packaging costs. 

We started out in 2002 as a 2 man owner/operator brewer, and remain so to this day.  Beer is our life, and our livelihood - We, and our families, appreciate your interest and support!

name: Porterhouse Restaurant and Brewpub
description: Porterhouse is no longer brewing; the brewhouse has left the building. The restaurant is still open! (Seriously, I'm certain of this: brewer's a good friend, and I helped find the brewhouse its new home.)

name: Ruth McGowans Brewpub
description:
The vision of Mary Ann and Mike Brigham – creating a neighborhood pub featuring hand-crafted beers brewed on site in gleaming copper tanks. The vision became a reality when the Brigham’s opened Ruth McGowan’s Brewpub in 2002. Since opening, Mary Ann and Mike remain hands-on owners

There are copper tanks which have become part of the Pub’s unique and cozy ambiance. Everyone who walks through the Pub doors is immediately made to feel at home by the friendly staff. The beers brewed on site have won many awards. All the elements of Mary Ann and Mike’s vision.

Brewmaster, Tim Gallagher, supplies the Pub with a selection of beer for any taste preference. Since Tim started brewing, he has created new popular beer recipes, production has more than doubled and their signature Cloverdale Ale has skyrocketed in popularity. CLOVER- DALE beer is now served on tap at several venues around the county, as well as sold in bottles at a number of retail outlets.

The Pub’s team (service staff, kitchen staff, Tim, Mary Ann and Mike) is dedicated to brewing the best hand-crafted beers, serving good food and keeping the atmosphere friendly.

Expansion is in the future to keep up with the demand for Ruth McGowan’s beer.

name: Southern Tier Brewing Company
description: Southern Tier Brewing Company was founded in 2004 by Phineas DeMink and Allen Yahn with the vision of bringing small batch brewing back to a region rich in brewing tradition. In 2003 Skip and Phin purchased the defunct Old Saddle Back Brewing Co. in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. All the equipment was removed and brought back to Lakewood, New York and set up at its new 10,000 square foot home, The Southern Tier Brewing Company. The Brewery began operations in February 2004 distributing regionally. By 2005 sales covered the majority of the New York State and the eastern half of Pennsylvania. In the beginning their two Flagship brands were a Pilsner and Mild Ale. Oh yeah they also brewed IPA! As it turned out the flagships were a flop and the IPA was a huge success. They next launched a line of seasonal beers which have gained great success. Since the beginning, Southern Tier has experienced steady growth, currently distributing to over 25% of the United States. Multiple expansions have been made to keep up with demand and the brewery continues to be innovative by producing new products.  Keep a look out for new products coming to stores near you.

name: Switchback Brewing Company
description:
Located in Burlington, Vermont, Switchback Brewing Company was founded in 2002 by a formally trained master brewer and his friend, the vision was to concentrate limited resources into making just a few beers to achieve the highest quality possible. The success of Switchback Ale beer has driven constant expansion for over 7 years and made the release of three Rotating Specials, Roasted Red Ale, Porter, and Slow-Fermented Brown Ale possible. Thank you for your support!

As in the beginning, Switchback continues to rely on word of mouth to increase sales, which have expanded into New York, New Hampshire, and Southern Maine. Switchback now brews several thousand barrels of beer each year, but its beer is only available on draught or in 1/2 and 1/6 barrel size kegs.

name: Terrapin Beer Company
description:
Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE.

Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival.  Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!

name: Vintage Brewing Co
description:
In 2002 Brittany, Trent & Mark Kraemer opened Vintage Spirits & Grill on the corner of University & Frances near the UW-Madison campus.
In 2009, they, along with Bryan & Scott manning and Mike Bridges decided to expand their family business and took over the vacant space formerly occupied by JT Whitneys.

They brought in a creative culinary team and set about creating a restaurant and brewery that features both excellent made-from-scratch food, and outstanding hand crafted beers.

"At Vintage Brewing Company, we're dedicated to bringing you world-class beer: fresh, flavorful, varied, & distinctive. We champion the craft of beer brewing as a harmony of art and science, where hard work and precision are guided by vision and passion. Cheers to great beer!"

name: ZwanzigZ Pizza & Brewing
description: ZwanzigZ Brewing is a two and a half year old addition to our independently owned pizzeria that opened in 2002. Located 40 minutes South of Indianapolis in Columbus Indiana. Follow I65 to exit 68 and head 5 minutes to just North of downtown. Nestled in a residential neighborhood, we'll make you feel like home with our fresh made deck oven pizzas, calzones, sandwiches and salads. Enjoy one of our 16 beers on tap including 4 Bourbon Barrel aged beers. In our family dining room, also enjoy any of our four craft sodas.
